doc.field: Series XXIII: Pride and Progress / The Right Stuff
Series XXIII: Pride and Progress / The Right Stuff
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 35 [2]--The Right Stuff [Air Date: 8/22/1986]
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 35 [2]--The Right Stuff [Air Date: 8/22/1986]

Pride and ProgressNews-highlights:1. Missouri legislature upholds state's sexual misconduct laws declaring same sex relations immoral2. Canada, radio talk show host faces disciplinary action for on-air anti-gay comments3. Interview with Joanne Mantell, the director of GMHC's study to reduce high-risk sex practices in the gay communityCOMMERCIAL: SF AIDS Foundation featuring Jose Sarria4. New Zealand, Parliament votes to decriminalize homosexual sex5. Chicago, National Organization of Gay and Lesbian Scientists and Technical Professionals produce brochure on the contributions to society of homosexual scientists5. Andy Humm discusses European openness towards AIDS education on the televisionCOMMERCIAL: "First Hand" gay magazine6. Warning about the unknown effects of spermicidal lube on rectal tissues during anal intercourse7. The US Office of Civil Rights unwilling to respond to reports of discrimination against persons with AIDSCOMMERCIAL: Phil Reed for New York State Senate8. Sports Report including an interview with Cliff Goulet on Gay Games '86 and clips from the Closing CeremonyCOMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp9. Outreach: Conversations with GMHC: Interview with Vin Longo of GMHC's Intake Department for new patients10. Closing credits
The Right Stuff:1. This week in gay history with Jeff BixbyCOMMERCIAL: "Woman Talk" theater piece2. Interview with director Derek Jarman on his film "Caravaggio" and the artist's life, with clips, tape cuts off
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 35 [2]--The Right Stuff [Air Date: 8/22/1986]: August 1986
